name: Baseflow Index relative to baseline
functionStatement: Ensures habitat availability and water quality during low water levels, and indicates non-storm conditions experienced the majority of the time.
descriptionMarkdown: Degree to which residual pools and riffle segments remain linked by continuous surface flow along the thalweg at normal low flow.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Compute Baseflow Index from daily flow records and compare to a regional or historical baseline where available.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: BFI closely matches the region's baseline.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: More than 40% difference from baseline, indicating extreme baseflow alteration.

references: USGS Groundwater Toolbox (BFI+, PART/WHAT/BASEFLOW) and/or USGS EflowStats
